alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 12:57PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Franklin County through 130 PM EDT... At 1257 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sontag to near Ferrum to near Oak Level. Movement was east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rocky Mount... Ferrum... and Sontag. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
